speaker: LANCE
text: Nay,’twill be this hour ere I have done weeping.

speaker: LANCE
text: All the kind of the Lances have this very fault. I have

speaker: LANCE
text: received my proportion like the Prodigious Son and

speaker: LANCE
text: am going with Sir Proteus to the Imperial’s court. I

speaker: LANCE
text: think Crab my dog be the sourest-natured dog that

speaker: LANCE
text: lives: my mother weeping, my father wailing, my

speaker: LANCE
text: sister crying, our maid howling, our cat wringing

speaker: LANCE
text: her hands, and all our house in a great perplexity,

speaker: LANCE
text: yet did not this cruel-hearted cur shed one tear. He

speaker: LANCE
text: is a stone, a very pibble stone, and has no more pity

speaker: LANCE
text: in him than a dog. A Jew would have wept to have

speaker: LANCE
text: seen our parting. Why, my grandam, having no

speaker: LANCE
text: eyes, look you, wept herself blind at my parting.

speaker: LANCE
text: Nay, I’ll show you the manner of it.

speaker: LANCE
text: This shoe is my father. No, this left shoe is

speaker: LANCE
text: my father; no, no, this left shoe is my mother. Nay,

speaker: LANCE
text: that cannot be so neither. Yes, it is so, it is so; it hath

speaker: LANCE
text: the worser sole. This shoe with the hole in it is my

speaker: LANCE
text: mother; and this my father. A vengeance on ’t, there

speaker: LANCE
text: ’tis! Now sir, this staff is my sister, for, look you, she

speaker: LANCE
text: is as white as a lily and as small as a wand. This hat

speaker: LANCE
text: is Nan, our maid. I am the dog. No, the dog is

speaker: LANCE
text: himself, and I am the dog. O, the dog is me, and I

speaker: LANCE
text: am myself. Ay, so, so. Now come I to my father:

speaker: LANCE
text: “Father, your blessing.” Now should not the shoe

speaker: LANCE
text: speak a word for weeping. Now should I kiss my

speaker: LANCE
text:
father.
                 
                He
                 
                kisses
                 
                one
                 
                shoe
                .
               Well, he weeps on. Now

speaker: LANCE
text: come I to my mother. O, that she could speak now

speaker: LANCE
text: like a wold woman! Well, I kiss her.

speaker: LANCE
text: Why, there ’tis; here’s my mother’s

speaker: LANCE
text: breath up and down. Now come I to my sister. Mark

speaker: LANCE
text: the moan she makes! Now the dog all this while

speaker: LANCE
text: sheds not a tear nor speaks a word. But see how I

speaker: LANCE
text: lay the dust with my tears.

speaker: PANTINO
text: Lance, away, away! Aboard. Thy master is

speaker: PANTINO
text: shipped, and thou art to post after with oars. What’s

speaker: PANTINO
text: the matter? Why weep’st thou, man? Away, ass.

speaker: PANTINO
text: You’ll lose the tide if you tarry any longer.

speaker: LANCE
text: It is no matter if the tied were lost, for it is the

speaker: LANCE
text: unkindest tied that ever any man tied.

speaker: PANTINO
text: What’s the unkindest tide?

speaker: LANCE
text: Why, he that’s tied here, Crab my dog.

speaker: PANTINO
text: Tut, man. I mean thou ’lt lose the flood and, in

speaker: PANTINO
text: losing the flood, lose thy voyage and, in losing thy

speaker: PANTINO
text: voyage, lose thy master and, in losing thy master,

speaker: PANTINO
text: lose thy service and, in losing thy service—

speaker: PANTINO
text: Why dost thou stop my

speaker: PANTINO
text: mouth?

speaker: LANCE
text: For fear thou shouldst lose thy tongue.

speaker: PANTINO
text: Where should I lose my tongue?

speaker: LANCE
text: In thy tale.

speaker: PANTINO
text: In thy tail!

speaker: LANCE
text: Lose the tide, and the voyage, and the master,

speaker: LANCE
text: and the service, and the tied. Why, man, if the river

speaker: LANCE
text: were dry, I am able to fill it with my tears; if the

speaker: LANCE
text: wind were down, I could drive the boat with my

speaker: LANCE
text: sighs.

speaker: PANTINO
text: Come. Come away, man. I was sent to call

speaker: PANTINO
text: thee.

speaker: LANCE
text: Sir, call me what thou dar’st.

speaker: PANTINO
text: Wilt thou go?

speaker: LANCE
text: Well, I will go.
